author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students of Periyar University taking out a rally to create awareness about cancer on Thursday.

A rally by students, and a seminar marked the observance of World Cancer Day at the Periyar University here on Thursday.

The event was brought up by the Internal Quality Assurance Cell of the university.

C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor, Periyar University, flagged off the rally, and walked along with the teachers and students of various departments.

Later, in his presidential address at the seminar, Dr. Swaminathan said that World Cancer Day was established by the Paris Charter adopted at the World Summit against Cancer for the New Millennium in Paris on February 4, 2000.

It aimed at saving millions of preventable deaths each year by creating awareness and educating the people about the disease; call on governments and individuals across the world to take action.

At present 8.2 million people die due to the dreaded cancer worldwide every year, of which four million die pre-maturely. K. Arthanari, managing director, Sri Gokulam Hospital, Salem, spoke on cancer prevention.

He said that prevention was better than cure and urged the audience to take a pledge to forgo certain things that caused cancer such as smoking, consumption of alcohol, red meat, and tobacco.

Dr. Arthanari also spoke on the recent diagnostic technologies used to detect cancer at early stages, and medication for the same. S. Kannan, coordinator, IQAC, explained the importance of World Cancer Day which unites the world’s population in the fight against cancer.
title: Rallies, seminar mark cancer day
